rules: Rule1: Provided that the company developed the plant, the drug is available.
Rule2: If the formulation is safe, then the formulation is tested.
Rule3: Supposing that the legislation is enforced, the legislation is compliant.
Rule4: Assuming that there was a senate vote on the legislation, then if there is a court ruling on the legislation, the legislation is under legal challenge.
Rule5: On the condition that the drug is manufactured, the drug is labeled.
Rule6: The drug is manufactured or the drug is imported.
Rule7: If the FDA approved the plant, then the company developed the plant.
Rule8: In case the drug is imported, the drug is available.
Rule9: The drug has side effects or, if it is not the case that the drug is prescribed or (if the drug is manufactured, the drug is available), then the drug is recalled.
Rule10: Should the drug be reformulated, the drug is not withdrawn.
Rule11: The drug undergoes quality assurance or the drug undergoes quality control.
Rule12: Provided the drug undergoes quality control, then if it is not the case that the drug is not available implies the drug is expired, the drug is reformulated.
Rule13: The drug undergoes batch testing or, if the drug undergoes quality assurance, then if it is not the case that the drug is not available implies the drug is expired, the drug is reformulated.
Rule14: Whenever the drug is packaged, the drug is available.
Rule15: If the drug is distributed, the drug is packaged.
Rule16: The drug is investigated or a lot of the drug is recalled or, if the drug is labeled, the drug is distributed.
Rule17: Either the doctor prescribed the drug or the pharmacy dispensed the drug.
Rule18: If the pharmacy dispensed the drug, then if the drug is manufactured, the drug is available.
Rule19: Whenever the patient was administered the drug, the drug is prescribed.
Rule20: Should the financial product be profitable, the financial product failed.
Rule21: On the condition that the financial product is profitable, the financial product does not fail.
Rule22: The financial product is profitable or, if the FDA does not approve the plant, the plant is not contaminated.
Rule23: Supposing the medical record is documented, then if the doctor prescribed the drug, the patient was administered the drug.
Rule24: In case an adverse event is reported, then if the doctor prescribed the drug, the patient was administered the drug.
Rule25: Provided an FDA report is submitted, the medical board is reviewed.
Rule26: An FDA report is submitted or a complaint is filed.
Rule27: If a complaint is filed, an adverse event is reported.
Rule28: The license is suspended or, if the medical board is reviewed, the medical record is documented.
Rule29: Whenever drug safety is monitored, then either the drug is prescribed or, if the drug is manufactured, the drug is available.
Rule30: Drug safety is monitored or the manufacturer is audited.
Rule31: If the company is fined, the plant is shutdown.
Rule32: In the event that the drug is dangerous, the drug is recalled.
Rule33: If the dispute is mediated, then if the patient files a lawsuit, the company reaches a settlement.
Rule34: In case the claim is arbitrated, then if the patient files a lawsuit, the company reaches a settlement.
Rule35: Given that the lawyer represents, counsel is advised.
Rule36: The lawyer represents or the expert is consulted.
Rule37: If the expert is consulted, the claim is arbitrated.
Rule38: Provided counsel is advised, the dispute is mediated.
Rule39: Should the FDA approve the drug, the drug is available.
Rule40: On the condition that the FDA approved the formulation, the drug is not banned.
Rule41: If the formulation is tested, the FDA approved the formulation.
Rule42: Supposing it is not the case that the legislation is an amendment or (if the legislation is enacted, the legislation is enforced), then there is a court ruling on the legislation.
Rule43: Provided it is not the case that if the drug is manufactured, the drug is available, then the drug is not counterfeit.
Rule44: Given that it is not the case that the drug is prescribed or (if the drug is manufactured, the drug is available), then the drug is toxic.
Rule45: Under the condition that it is not the case that the drug is prescribed or (if the drug is manufactured, the drug is available), then the drug is not recalled.
Rule46: If it is not the case that if the drug is safe, the drug does not have side effects, then the drug is contraindicated.
Rule47: Provided it is not the case that if the manufacturer is audited, then either the drug is prescribed or (if the drug is manufactured, the drug is available), then the company is fined.
Rule48: Supposing it is not the case that if the drug is toxic, the drug is dangerous, then the patient files a lawsuit.
Rule49: In case it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the drug is manufactured, the drug is available, then the drug is counterfeit, then the shipment is seized.

Rule50: Provided it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the drug is manufactured, the drug is available, then the drug is counterfeit, then the shipment is not seized, then the individual is prosecuted.
Rule51: Should it is not the case that if the FDA does not approve the drug, the formulation is safe, then the formulation underwent clinical trial.
Rule52: In the event that it is not the case that if the FDA does not approve the drug, the formulation is safe, then the formulation does not undergo clinical trial.
Rule53: Whenever it is not the case that the drug is not available implies the drug is expired, then the drug is withdrawn.
Rule54: If the FDA does not approve the plant, the plant is contaminated.
Rule55: In case the FDA does not approve the drug, the drug is banned.
Rule56: Provided the drug is not available, the legislation is enacted.
Rule57: Supposing the drug is not available, the legislation is not compliant.
facts: Fact1: There was a senate vote on the legislation.
Fact3: The legislation is not an amendment.
Fact4: The legislation is not under legal challenge.
Fact5: The drug is not prescribed.
Fact6: The drug is not contraindicated.
Fact7: The drug is not expired.
Fact8: The drug does not undergo batch testing.
Fact9: A lot of the drug is not recalled.
Fact10: The drug is not investigated.
Fact11: The license is not suspended.
Fact12: The plant is not shutdown.
Fact13: The company does not reach a settlement.
Fact14: The individual is not prosecuted.
